pullRequest.body:
This PR does two things, both related to statements of HÃ¶lder's inequality:

1. In the generic statements involving a general map `b : E â†’ F â†’ G` (which we think of as a continuous bilinear map despite the fact that these are not quite the hypotheses), we loosen the assumptions on `b` so that it need not have norm bounded by 1. This makes it possible to use general continuous bilinear maps in the forthcoming #21583, and addresses the concerns in #6108.
2. Changes the statements to make use of the new `ENNReal.HolderTriple` type class. Among other things, this makes some existing lemmas specialized to `âˆž` redundant, so we deprecate them.

Closes #6108.

---

- [x] depends on: #21854

If this doesn't completely address #6108, let me know and I can do the rest of what you wanted.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21854~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Is there any chance you can split this PR into:
* "allow for bilinear maps of norm greater than one in HÃ¶lder's inequality"
* "use `HolderTriple`"

? The current diff is quite hard to read and the two changes seem essentially disjoint

I don't think the diff being hard to read would change much if I split it. The "use HÃ¶lder triple" changes are pretty minor in terms of diff size (but I would essentially have to recreate them from scratch if I were to try and split the PR, and then I would have an annoying merge for the second PR unless I was very careful with git).

The main issue for the diff is that when generalizing to bilinear maps, I found it much easier to reprove some of the results from scratch (and in at least one case, shorten the proof considerably), by taking another approach. For example, I used `ENNReal.trichotomy` in one proof to give myself nicer case splits, and I stayed in the realm of `eLpNorm` before passing to the integral in another in order to make it easier to pull the constant out.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13407513062/job/37450063262)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13407513062/job/37450063047)

Thanks!

maintainer delegate

```suggestion
    (.of_forall fun _ => by simpa using nnnorm_smul_le _ _) :)
```
if you want while you're at it
Do you think we should keep the `c = 1` lemmas as convenient special cases?

no, as you can see with the `mul` and `smul` results, it seems to only add an extra invocation of `simp`, so it's minor, and I think those are currently the only places the results are used in Mathlib.
Would you mind commenting that on https://github.com/fpvandoorn/carleson/pull/231? @js2357 is similarly adding `c = 1` special cases there
oops, sorry, I missed this.

nodes.title: Consequences of HÃ¶lder inequality for continuous bilinear maps

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: allow for bilinear maps of norm greater than one in HÃ¶lder's inequality and use `HolderTriple`

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

source.title: feat: HÃ¶lder triples and multiplication of `MeasureTheory.Lp` functions

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21854~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Is there any chance you can split this PR into:
* "allow for bilinear maps of norm greater than one in HÃ¶lder's inequality"
* "use `HolderTriple`"

? The current diff is quite hard to read and the two changes seem essentially disjoint

I don't think the diff being hard to read would change much if I split it. The "use HÃ¶lder triple" changes are pretty minor in terms of diff size (but I would essentially have to recreate them from scratch if I were to try and split the PR, and then I would have an annoying merge for the second PR unless I was very careful with git).

The main issue for the diff is that when generalizing to bilinear maps, I found it much easier to reprove some of the results from scratch (and in at least one case, shorten the proof considerably), by taking another approach. For example, I used `ENNReal.trichotomy` in one proof to give myself nicer case splits, and I stayed in the realm of `eLpNorm` before passing to the integral in another in order to make it easier to pull the constant out.

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13407513062/job/37450063262)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13407513062/job/37450063047)
